channel.title: [Project] RS Fan Site Script

item.title: [Project] RS Fan Site Script
item.dc:creator: @RevengePK RevengePK
item.description:
@RevengePK wrote:

[quote=“Ruby, post:5, topic:497750”]Don’t ever release a script for any kind of public testing or release if it’s insecure, you’re just asking for others databases to be manipulated, it doesn’t take much to secure a script. Also, why are you still using deprecated code?:S I told you the last time you shouldn’t learn the basics using deprecated code, if you must stick with procedural then use mysqli_ instead of mysql_. Not worth the disadvantages.

Also if you must echo lots of HTML, just use:

echo '<div id="something">
            sgsdfgsdg
                 dgdsgsdfgsd  
             fgdsgdgfdsfg 
        </div>';

Rather than a lot of echo statements and ugly code :P.[/quote]

Will fix in the next release!

Read full topic

item.title: [Project] RS Fan Site Script
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

Don’t ever release a script for any kind of public testing or release if it’s insecure, you’re just asking for others databases to be manipulated, it doesn’t take much to secure a script. Also, why are you still using deprecated code?:S I told you the last time you shouldn’t learn the basics using deprecated code, if you must stick with procedural then use mysqli_ instead of mysql_. Not worth the disadvantages.

Also if you must echo lots of HTML, just use:

echo '<div id="something">
            sgsdfgsdg
                 dgdsgsdfgsd  
             fgdsgdgfdsfg 
        </div>';

Rather than a lot of echo statements and ugly code :P.

Read full topic

item.title: [Project] RS Fan Site Script
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Instead of all this:

else {
                include '/tmpl/ovr/ovrHead.php';
                include '/tmpl/navAndHead.php';
                echo '<div id="content">';
                echo '<div id="memMessage">';
                echo '<center><strong><p>You must login to view this page! <a href="login.php">Login</a> or <a href="register.php">register</a>.</p></strong></center>';
                echo '</div>';
                echo '</div>';
                echo '<div id="sideBar">';
                echo '</div>';
                echo '<div class="clear"></div>';
                include '/tmpl/ovr/ovrFoot.php';
        }

You can just end the php tag and continue the html, like so:

else {
                include '/tmpl/ovr/ovrHead.php';
                include '/tmpl/navAndHead.php';
?>
                <div id="content">
                <div id="memMessage">
                <center><strong><p>You must login to view this page! <a href="login.php">Login</a> or <a href="register.php">register</a>.</p></strong></center>
                </div>
                </div>
                <div id="sideBar">
                </div>
                <div class="clear"></div>
<?php
                include '/tmpl/ovr/ovrFoot.php';
        }

Saves a lot of echos, in regards to the html, kill the tag.

Read full topic

item.title: [Project] RS Fan Site Script
item.dc:creator: @RevengePK RevengePK
item.description:
@RevengePK wrote:

I am currently developing a RuneScape fansite script, I have been working on it for a bit and I have gotten alot done already. The script will not be used by me, instead I will be releasing it as an open source script and updating it, etc. The code currently isn’t the most secure, although I have implemented a bit of security into it. This is the official dev/update thread for the script.

CODE SAMPLE

<?php 
	session_start();
	require_once '/config/dataConfig.php';
	require_once '/config/siteConfig.php';
	$pageName = "Member";
	if($_SESSION['loggedIn'] === 1) {
		$result = mysql_query("SELECT id,email,title,avatar FROM users WHERE username ='$username'");
		$row = mysql_fetch_array($result);
		if (!$result) {
			echo 'Could not run query: ' . mysql_error();
			exit;
		}
		$username = mysql_real_escape_string($_SESSION['username']);
		$id = mysql_real_escape_string($row[0]);
		$title = mysql_real_escape_string($row[2]);
		include '/tmpl/ovr/ovrHead.php';
		include '/tmpl/navAndHead.php';
		echo '<div id="content">';
		echo '<h1>Welcome, <a href="profile.php?user='.$username.'">'.$username.'</a>!</h1>';
		echo '<div id="memMessage">';
		echo '<p>Below are a few more options for you to customize your profile! Take a minute to update your profile!</p>';
		include 'tmpl/editForm.php';
		echo '</div>';
		echo '</div>';
		echo '<div id="sideBar">';
		echo '</div>';
		echo '<div class="clear"></div>';
		include '/tmpl/ovr/ovrFoot.php';
	}
	else {
		include '/tmpl/ovr/ovrHead.php';
		include '/tmpl/navAndHead.php';
		echo '<div id="content">';
		echo '<div id="memMessage">';
		echo '<center><strong><p>You must login to view this page! <a href="login.php">Login</a> or <a href="register.php">register</a>.</p></strong></center>';
		echo '</div>';
		echo '</div>';
		echo '<div id="sideBar">';
		echo '</div>';
		echo '<div class="clear"></div>';
		include '/tmpl/ovr/ovrFoot.php';
	}
?>

Update Log:
Complete
Almost Done
Not Started

User Registration
User Login
User Profile
User Update Profile
User Logout
User Ranks
User Display Page (Members page)
User Submitted Guides
Latest Guides
Site News
Guide Moderation

  • WILL BE ADDING MORE -

BETA RELEASE - PLEASE REPORT BUGS
Fan Site V0.1

Note: If you want to be on the dev team (currently isn’t one) contact me VIA private message!

Some Media: (will add more)


(aware of the nav bug, will fic with next release.)
